ETYMOLOGY: From Old French bacon (c. 1300), from a Germanic source, related to Old High German bacho ('buttock, ham') and Old English bæc ('back'), referring to the back or side meat of a pig.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun). Uncountable: cannot be counted.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Cured meat from the back or sides of a pig, often sliced thinly and fried.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 腌制的猪肉，通常是猪背部或腹部的肉，常切成薄片煎炸食用。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I like to have crispy bacon and eggs for breakfast.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我喜欢早餐吃香脆的培根和鸡蛋。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A group of words established by usage as having a meaning not deducible from those of the individual words.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To earn a living; to provide financial support for one's family.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: After getting the new job, she was finally able to bring home the bacon.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 找到新工作后，她终于能养家糊口了。
